snippet: The Greek government said Wednesday that it would seek a vote of confidence in Parliament next week in a bid to quash mounting speculation about early elections and to keep flagging economic reforms on track.
abstract: Greek government says it will seek a vote of confidence in Parliament in a bid to quash mounting speculation about early elections and to keep flagging economic reforms on track.
lead_paragraph: The Greek government said Wednesday that it would seek a vote of confidence in Parliament next week in a bid to quash mounting speculation about early elections and to keep flagging economic reforms on track.

headline.main: Greece: Push for a Confidence Vote
headline.print_headline: Greece: Push for a Confidence Vote
